prompt.prompt:
Choose the statement you most agree with about the scatterplot.

 ![](./scatter-positive.png)
distractors: There appears to be a strong negative correlation.
There appears to be a perfect correlation.
There appears to be a weak negative correlation.

answer.answer: There appears to be a positive correlation.

prompt.prompt:
A strong negative correlation would have an r-value that is closest to:

<!-- - -->

Twenty-nine individuals are represented by the points in the chart below.

 The x-axis indicates the number of years worked for a particular company, and the y-axis represents salary.

 ![](./salary-lr-plot.png) 

 The questions on the next 3 slides will focus on this chart.

Individuals at this company should expect that their salaries will increase about ____ every 2 years.

 ![](./salary-lr-plot.png)

Use the predictor function to calculate how much money you expect an employee with 15 years of experience to earn.

 ![](./salary-lr-plot.png)

Use the predictor function to determine about how much money would you expect an employee with no experience to earn.

 ![](./salary-lr-plot.png)

The chart shows some restaurant data. 

 ![](./restaurant-lr-plot.png) 

 Describe the relationship between dollars spent and dollars tipped.
